summary: When do you think sansa is going to wear that dress? The dress once again gives 'don't touch me' vibe & I really thought jonsa...
question: When do you think sansa is going to wear that dress? The dress once again gives 'don't touch me' vibe & I really thought jonsa will have a intimate moment in broken tower in s8e1 last scene as a parallel to jaime/cersei scene in s1e1 & sansa would have let her guard down. Also, I'll be honest here,the moment I saw the poster I got a vamp/sexy vibe & seconds later evil vibe probably because dress is shiny lol.
answer:
Hi, anons!

This dress perplexes me, I have to admit. The texture most of all. The first time I saw it, I thought of dragon scales and dragonglass and the Tully armor. Then I saw bark and even a slight feather resemblance. I’ve seen someone compare it to the pattern of dragonfly wings and that makes sense too.

But the more I look at it, the less it looks like fish scales and the Tully armor. The pattern and texture and color–they’re all completely wrong. Like anon #2, I think it lacks symmetry. Granted, it can be inspired by fish scales. Sansa might be making it her own thing.

Sometimes I’ve wondered whether she’d use this as a statement piece, sort of like she did with the Vale dress anon #3 mentions. That, after the truth about Jon comes out, she’d show the world that she stands beside him. She already cloaked him as a Stark and now she’ll wear dragon scales for him to show that they’re a team. Something I wouldn’t particularly like. Not the gesture, mind you–it’s a good gesture and clothes do come off–but her adopting dragon scales since I’m not particularly Jon-embracing-Targness positive. It prefer it if she Starkified him even more (perhaps by literally making him one through marriage ahem).

Like anon #3, I’ve wondered about the feather connection too. Because it does look a bit like feathers–especially with that raven-like color. And Jon was a crow and Bran’s a raven and she’s been called little dove and little bird, but those nicknames were undermining, belittling, and a mockingbird took her under his wing and used and abused her. So are feathers actually empowering? Perhaps they are, if she takes what people have used to hurt her and makes it into armor.

Dragonglass still makes sense. This dress doesn’t look like armor in any way, but if it’s supposed to resemble dragonglass that could be it. This could be her symbolic armor for the long night.

But there’s one texture I dismissed at first because I was a dumbass and googled coal for photos and it didn’t look right so I dropped it. Or tried to. I couldn’t shake it and then I googled charcoal and just… oh there it is.

It looks like charcoal--the shine, the asymmetry–and it feels like attitude. Like a statement, like a message to the conqueror who uses fire as a weapon: “You can’t burn me because I’ve already been burned and I’m still alive and kicking.” Like a phoenix rising from the ashes (which makes me wonder whether this is the last dark dress she’ll wear before she bests her enemies and lets color back in).

Or I’m just trying to make sense of a texture that looks too much like too many different things because a designer was creative and didn’t take a literal approach. She thought the print of this Sansa s7 dress–the one some say looks like the Bolton sigil–looked like swimming fishes, after all.

It doesn’t have to be so damn literal.

Like anon #1, this new dress gives me “don’t touch me” vibes, the way it covers her from neck to ankle with long narrow sleeves + the belt. The silhouette is just like her s7 dresses too (sans the shoulder things). And yet the texture makes it look brittle and broken, as if the armor has already started to crack and is ready to fall off.

And when she’ll wear this… Hibberd (GoT’s Entertainment Weekly person) called this Sansa’s battle dress, iirc. So I assume she’ll wear it on the night of the battle. Unless he means a different kind of battle. Perhaps this is her “the gloves are off” dress, one she’ll wear to show that she means business and can’t be bossed around in her own home.

Either way, I don’t think Jon and Sansa will have a physically intimate scene in the broken tower to echo Jaime and Cersei in s08e01. I have a hard time seeing them being intimate before a wedding (both because they’re J/C foils and because I doubt Jon would want to dishonor Sansa that way), and so I think Sansa’s belt and armor won’t come off properly until the wedding night (or later still, if their wedding night is interrupted).

I don’t know, anons. I’m basically just rambling, thinking out loud. This dress still perplexes me. As much as it looks like charcoal to me, it can still be dragon scales or fish scales or feathers or dragonglass or something else entirely. I really don’t know.

Thanks for the asks!

blog.name: imsopoetrightfuck
blog.title: imsopoeticrightfuck
blog.description:
Writer. Fan warrior. Sarcastic. Call me Luna! Questions + Requests accepted.

House: Gryffindor/Ravenclaw

summary: Game of Thrones Season 1 Review
title: Game of Thrones Season 1 Review
body:
MAJOR SPOILERS TO GO

So, for reasons, I was like fine, yup now is the time I’ll see on IMDb how many episodes and stuff there are. THERE’S ONLY TEN?! So I was like easy, I can do that.

My thoughts:
Arya is my favourite without a doubt. She’s clever and I so want her to be a swordswoman. And now she’s heading to the wall?! So much potential. 

I really like Sansa too- at first I thought she’d annoy me because she wouldn’t understand the game but she does- oh, she does understand the game, and she is terrified and clever. I love how now she knows who Joffrey is, but she is clever. 

Also, fuck Joffrey.

I love all the Starks to be honest, though Mama Stark the least. I don’t know what but something about Catelyn just makes me go hmm.

I know that GoT has a rep for killing everyone but I gasped when Ned Stark was killed! Wow, when he wanted to see Arya one last time and she wasn’t there? Good. His whole arc was really, really good. His loyalty and honour, and assumption that the Lannisters would play the game on his terms, screwed everything over royally and it was great. 

And I was so happy when Daenarys’ brother was killed. What a prick. 

So, Daenarys- I like her, don’t love her. She’ll do something badass like eat the heart or claim the slaves as her people or stand up as Khalessi and I’ll be like yes!! But she also does other stuff like try dark magic to save her husband?? Obviously the price would be your son?? Whatever, stupidity is allowed, dark magic is always the wrong call. Also, Drogo was like, a literal rapist in every sense so I really was not rooting for him to live. Not a fan of the Dothraki people in general to be honest. It also seems like a really shady call on the side of the Targaryans to be like- I’m going to marry into this people because they have an army which is good logic, but they will not cross an ocean to reach the land we are trying to reclaim? And their succession isn’t through the bloodline, it’s whoever’s the most powerful warrior at the time? If the Khal you chose were to drop dead, you’re screwed and you’ve lost everything. Which is exactly what happened. I love that she is the Dragon through and she’s fire-proof and has some dragons!!
I’ve seen a lot of people saying that GoT is like torture porn and I get it because Hollywood sucks right, but they haven’t shown any graphic rape, and all the guys that fit that description- Daenarys’ brother, Drogo etc are dead. So I don’t think the narrative is too much on the rapey side, though I’m not a fan of the cavalier nature prostitution is treated, and how it hasn’t really been addressed that that is awful, you know? I’m waiting on that point. Also, the nudity- awkward and unnecessary but that’s the angle the show is aimed at, it’s the point so fine whatever. Even though the ratio was massively off, I was pleased it wasn’t just women, because in a 15 movie a woman will be naked and a man will be shirtless because that’s the same? So even though it was skewed I’m glad it did at least a little go both ways. 

So, Cersei. Damn she’s clever. If it wasn’t for the whole, you know, incest thing, I’d like her. Just, ew. God. It’s awful. I know that’s the point but god. She is gonna screw everyone over, though. Be afraid. 

Also, why does Cersei want Joffrey to marry Sansa? Like in the beginning, she wants a leash on that Starks, that makes sense, whatever. But now that the Starks are rebels, why does she care about Sansa? Why this girl specifically? I know they’re keeping her for ransom but they wouldn’t have to be planning to marry her off to the king they could just keep her somewhere. I really hope that’s addressed. 

I will say that all the characters are generally very well written and so interesting. 

Also, the show majorly overestimates my ability to remember names and noble families. I suppose that they’re trying to avoid exposition dumps and everything is written in such a way that I can follow everything, but yeah. It’s just a lot at times when I’m like, who are you? Particularly because I am the absolute worst at faces. 

I don’t care too much about Jon Snow at the moment because I feel like his plot will become relevant in a few seasons when whatever’s outside the wall comes to play so for now, while he’s stuck on the Night’s Watch, there’s not a hell of a lot he can do. His friends are cool though. 

I have this crack theory about Jon Snow that he’s actually one of the King’s bastards and will make a play for the throne. Because literally all of Ned’s character is about honour but he cheated on his wife?? And it wasn’t addressed or explained? Robert didn’t seem like he was in on the secret so maybe Ned felt bad for Jon’s mother and promised to take the boy in? And if it was known that he was the King’s bastard being raised in a Lord’s hosuehold that would defo raise some eyebrows so he kept it to himself? Though if that was the truth Catelyn would know so… idk. 

Next: Tyrion. He is… interesting. He is kind in some ways to Bran, and just seems to float along and serve himself and he is determined to be clever, useful and prove his worth? I don’t love what he’s like with prostitutes. Just- he’s a lot but that is good. He’ll probably have a bigger role now that Ned Stark is dead. 

Just- the season was well-written and interesting, and I’m excited for season 2. Lots of pieces are in interesting positions. 

It’s so hard trying to avoid spoilers, I always want to look up actor’s names but I’m scared on seeing on their page how long they were on the show for lol. Because I have not been spoiled, I do not know anything about who is alive or dead or what the hell is happening in the current season. 

On it goes!

It also seems like a really shady call on the side of the Targaryans to be like- I’m going to marry into this people because they have an army which is good logic, but they will not cross an ocean to reach the land we are trying to reclaim? And their succession isn’t through the bloodline, it’s whoever’s the most powerful warrior at the time? If the Khal you chose were to drop dead, you’re screwed and you’ve lost everything. Which is exactly what happened. I love that she is the Dragon through and she’s fire-proof and has some dragons!!
I’ve seen a lot of people saying that GoT is like torture porn and I get it because Hollywood sucks right, but they haven’t shown any graphic rape, and all the guys that fit that description- Daenarys’ brother, Drogo etc are dead. So I don’t think the narrative is too much on the rapey side, though I’m not a fan of the cavalier nature prostitution is treated, and how it hasn’t really been addressed that that is awful, you know? I’m waiting on that point. Also, the nudity- awkward and unnecessary but that’s the angle the show is aimed at, it’s the point so fine whatever. Even though the ratio was massively off, I was pleased it wasn’t just women, because in a 15 movie a woman will be naked and a man will be shirtless because that’s the same? So even though it was skewed I’m glad it did at least a little go both ways. 

So, Cersei. Damn she’s clever. If it wasn’t for the whole, you know, incest thing, I’d like her. Just, ew. God. It’s awful. I know that’s the point but god. She is gonna screw everyone over, though. Be afraid. 

Also, why does Cersei want Joffrey to marry Sansa? Like in the beginning, she wants a leash on that Starks, that makes sense, whatever. But now that the Starks are rebels, why does she care about Sansa? Why this girl specifically? I know they’re keeping her for ransom but they wouldn’t have to be planning to marry her off to the king they could just keep her somewhere. I really hope that’s addressed. 

I will say that all the characters are generally very well written and so interesting. 

Also, the show majorly overestimates my ability to remember names and noble families. I suppose that they’re trying to avoid exposition dumps and everything is written in such a way that I can follow everything, but yeah. It’s just a lot at times when I’m like, who are you? Particularly because I am the absolute worst at faces. 

I don’t care too much about Jon Snow at the moment because I feel like his plot will become relevant in a few seasons when whatever’s outside the wall comes to play so for now, while he’s stuck on the Night’s Watch, there’s not a hell of a lot he can do. His friends are cool though. 

I have this crack theory about Jon Snow that he’s actually one of the King’s bastards and will make a play for the throne. Because literally all of Ned’s character is about honour but he cheated on his wife?? And it wasn’t addressed or explained? Robert didn’t seem like he was in on the secret so maybe Ned felt bad for Jon’s mother and promised to take the boy in? And if it was known that he was the King’s bastard being raised in a Lord’s hosuehold that would defo raise some eyebrows so he kept it to himself? Though if that was the truth Catelyn would know so… idk. 

Next: Tyrion. He is… interesting. He is kind in some ways to Bran, and just seems to float along and serve himself and he is determined to be clever, useful and prove his worth? I don’t love what he’s like with prostitutes. Just- he’s a lot but that is good. He’ll probably have a bigger role now that Ned Stark is dead. 

Just- the season was well-written and interesting, and I’m excited for season 2. Lots of pieces are in interesting positions. 

It’s so hard trying to avoid spoilers, I always want to look up actor’s names but I’m scared on seeing on their page how long they were on the show for lol. Because I have not been spoiled, I do not know anything about who is alive or dead or what the hell is happening in the current season. 

On it goes!

summary: The LOTR/Jonsa Fic is Being Posted
title: The LOTR/Jonsa Fic is Being Posted
body:
The Prologue:


“The world is changed,” Old Nan would always begin the tale. “I feel it in the water. I feel it in the earth. I smell it in the air. Much that once was is lost; for none now live who remember it.”

Many of the Stark children would listen to the opening lines with rapt attention as she put down her knitting needles and began one of the North’s most told stories. But as they grew older, one by one they would begin to roll their eyes and maybe even leave the room to go riding or pursue some other worthwhile task like training at swords or sewing. But Bran never left; he always listened to the tale in full. The scary ones were his favorite. “Keep going, Nan,” he’d say.

“All right, little lord,” she’d comply with the continued click of her knitting needles.

“It began with the Children of the Forest. They had dwelled in the deep woods for untold ages, living off the land and carving faces into their weirwood trees. The Children made peace with the First Men…at first. But they were all of them deceived.

“For the men built permanent settlements and brought with them bronze weapons, great leathern shields, the first horses, and their own gods. And they cut down the Children’s trees.

“One by one the forests were felled for the sake of cities and fires, and the war began. The Children were outnumbered and losing strength with the loss of their magic and their trees.

“But there were some who resisted. They needed a weapon. A pack of Children found one of these men lingering in their forest and captured him. Leaf, the leader of the pack, plunged her obsidian dagger into the man’s heart and witnessed as his eyes turned blue and his skin transformed from flesh to ice. In that moment, the first White Walker was formed, the Night King, who would lead the army of the dead and bring about the Long Night. 

“This would be a winter worse than all the rest. A winter when the snows fall a hundred feet deep, when the sun hides for years, and children are born and live and die, all in darkness. That is when the White Walkers move through the woods. Kings froze to death in their castles, same as the shepherds in their huts, and women smothered their babies rather than see them starve, and wept and felt their tears freeze on their cheeks. The White Walkers swept through cities and kingdoms, riding their dead horses, hunting with their packs of pale spiders big as hounds…”

“All right, that’s enough,” Robb would usually interrupt.

“No!” Bran would protest. “Robb—Nan—please I want to hear the rest!”

“And wake up from nightmares about the Others in the middle of the night like I used to about the blue-eyed giant Mecumba? I think not,” Robb would reason with a good-natured laugh. “The White Walkers aren’t real, Bran. There is no Night King coming for us.”

But Robb was wrong; winter was coming and the dead with it. Not that Robb had lived long enough to see it. He’d died in the Twins with their mother when word of the return of the Night King and the Long Night were yet naught but whispers in the dark.

title: Game of Thrones Lore: History and Geography of House Kidwell
excerpt: House Kidwell of Ivy Hall is a noble house from Ivy Hall in the Reach. According to semi-canon sources they blazon their arms with pale green ivy bendy on black masonry. The meaning of 'bendy' in this context is unclear, as in heraldic terminology that wo

summary: I started thinking about Littlefinger asking Sansa why she’s not happy and I can’t stop. I know this is often referenced as a...
body:
I started thinking about Littlefinger asking Sansa why she’s not happy and I can’t stop. I know this is often referenced as a Jonsa scene, which I get, but even beyond that the context is baffling.

Imagine asking that of a woman who

  • watched her beloved wolf be murdered for no reason
  • watched her father be gruesomely executed and later made to look at his severed head
  • was beaten, used and humiliated as a political pawn as a CHILD in a place she had no one
  • found out her eldest brother and mother were murdered in the same night (the same 2 family members who were supposed to win a war to liberate her and also take down the house who killed her father)
  • was married to tyrion as a further act of humiliation and a reminder that she has no control over her life (again, still a child here)
  • was held hostage by a creepy older dude who was in love with her and made her call him father
  • was then almost murdered by her crazy aunt because she saw said creepy older dude kiss sansa (against sansa’s will)
  • was sold like a goat to a man who violated and invaded her home, allegedly murdered her two baby brothers and raped her repeatedly
  • saw a maid murdered and flayed for trying to help her escape
  • then saw her baby brother who she recently learned was not dead after all be murdered trying to escape her psycho husband

Like that’s not even everything but…I mean. That scene is truly the most audacious “you should smile more” of all time.

Imagine asking that of a woman who

  • watched her beloved wolf be murdered for no reason
  • watched her father be gruesomely executed and later made to look at his severed head
  • was beaten, used and humiliated as a political pawn as a CHILD in a place she had no one
  • found out her eldest brother and mother were murdered in the same night (the same 2 family members who were supposed to win a war to liberate her and also take down the house who killed her father)
  • was married to tyrion as a further act of humiliation and a reminder that she has no control over her life (again, still a child here)
  • was held hostage by a creepy older dude who was in love with her and made her call him father
  • was then almost murdered by her crazy aunt because she saw said creepy older dude kiss sansa (against sansa’s will)

  • then saw her baby brother who she recently learned was not dead after all be murdered trying to escape her psycho husband

summary: Rain and Storm
title: Rain and Storm
body:
Written for day 3 of @jonsaspringblossoms based on the prompt RAIN or SUNSHINE or STORM

The storm and rain are the perfect companions for a lazy day with a good book. But just when Sansa is about to start reading the doorbell rings and a soaked Jon shows up at her doorstep.

Modern AU // College AU

Sansa made herself comfortable in the lazy chair in the living room. The heater filled the cold room with warmth, but she draped an extra fleece blanket over her legs. On the table next to her stood a big mug filled with damping hot tea. The mug stood next to the newest novel she had bought a few days ago, even though she had promised her mother to read all the books she already owned first.

The rain ticking against the window was nothing but background music. The howling wind circling around the house to attempt to rip the tiles off the roof simply added to the spooky atmosphere. It was the perfect day to just stay in and read, to get lost in a story and to only find her way back to the real world after she had read it all.

But she had barely read three pages when the doorbell echoed through the empty house. For a brief second she contemplated simply not opening, but then the doorbell rang again.

Longer this time. And much louder too.

With a soft moan Sansa stood up from her chair and she shivered when her bare feet touched the ice cold floor. On the tips of her toes she rushed towards the front door and she opened it only slightly, determined to simply send the intruder away as soon as she could.

“Sansa!” Jon’s dark black curls were glued to his forehead and the contours of his muscles were clearly visible through his soaked white shirt. He had his arms wrapped around him, but his teeth were clattering and his entire body shook visibly. “Thank goodness you’re home.” He let out a relieved sigh. “I wasn’t really looking forward to walking another three miles like this.”

Sansa thought about her book, waiting for her to be read, but then she opened the front door a little wider so Jon could step inside. “What were you even doing out there? They’ve warned countless of times that a huge storm was coming and that we shouldn’t leave our homes, unless in the case of an emergency.”

“I know.” Jon nodded. On the floor around him a small puddle was forming. His hair was dripping and drops of water rolled down his skin. “But I really had to get my book back to the library.”

Sansa widened her eyes and dropped her jaw while she crossed her arms over her chest. “A book? You’re risking your life over a library fine?” She rolled her eyes and then she opened the door to the bathroom to get Jon a large and clean towel. “The wind could have blown who knows what in your face or on top of you! They’d really understand if you’d be bringing in this book a few days late.”

“I thought the weather forecast was exaggerating.” Jon shrugged and took the towel from her. He buried his face in the soft fabric and dried himself as much as possible. “Can I borrow your dryer for a minute?” He didn’t even wait for her answer and pulled his shirt over his head.

Sansa knew it was impolite to stare, but she had to stare anyway. Her eyes followed the sharp lines of his muscles and she fought the urge to place her hand on his naked chest to touch his gleaming skin. “Yes, sure, of course…” She stuttered and she swallowed when Jon took off his jeans too.

He was standing in her hallway wearing nothing but a black boxer short and instead of taking his wet clothes from him and putting them in the dryer, Sansa just stood there, unable to move.

She was not sure why she was speechless and why she stood frozen to the floor. She knew Jon ever since she had been a little girl. And just like every little girl she had had a small crush on her big brother’s best friend. But she had thought that that crush had subsided, that her heart had calmed down, that Jon was nothing but an amazing friend. It seemed she had been hopelessly wrong.

“Sansa?” Jon walked a little closer towards her and he pressed the palms of his hands to her cheeks. “Are you alright?” He cocked his head and Sansa swallowed. He was not making things better now. Actually, he was mostly making things worse.

Her heart was now racing in her chest and she felt the adrenaline rushing through her veins. Every cell in her body and every sensitive part of her skin was reacting. “Yes, yes…” She tripped over her words once more and she wished for a hole in the ground that would swallow her. “It’s just…” She let her eyes wander of his body once more and she stuck the tip of her tongue between her slightly parted lips. “You’ve surprised me a little.”

“I surprised you?” Jon raised his eyebrows, but a smirk appeared on his face. “In a good or in a bad way?” He kept his hands firmly on her cheeks and he leaned in slightly so Sansa could feel his warm breath on her nose.

She swallowed. “That depends on what will happen next.” Her voice was nothing but a soft whisper and a little reluctantly she placed her hands on his shoulders. Touching his muscles was even better than looking at them.

“What do you want to happen?” Jon spoke softly and his lips were now almost touching hers.

She smiled. “I want you to kiss me.” When her glance met his she saw a spark there, a small spark that had never been there before. “And more.” She let his shoulder go and placed her flat hand on his bare chest. “Because I don’t think I can get over you a second time.”

“A second time?” Jon’s nose brushed hers and her cheeks started glowing.

“Don’t tell me you didn’t know.” Sansa’s arms circled around his neck and somehow she was afraid that at some point Jon would step back.

But he didn’t.

“It’s impossible that you’ve never noticed my crush on you and all the pathetic excuses I came up with to talk to you and get your attention.”

“I always thought…” Jon took a deep breath. “It was simply because you hadn’t really met any other guys yet.”

“I have now.” Sansa closed the remaining distance between them and pressed her soft lips on his. She couldn’t believe she was really doing this. She couldn’t believe she was kissing Jon Snow. And she most of all couldn’t believe he was not pulling back. “And they can’t compete with you.” She kissed him more firmly now and she buried her hands in his still wet curls.

When Jon kissed her back the wet clothes in need of a dryer were forgotten. Just like time and the raging storm.

Sansa knew it was impolite to stare, but she had to stare anyway. Her eyes followed the sharp lines of his muscles and she fought the urge to place her hand on his naked chest to touch his gleaming skin. “Yes, sure, of course…” She stuttered and she swallowed when Jon took off his jeans too.

He was standing in her hallway wearing nothing but a black boxer short and instead of taking his wet clothes from him and putting them in the dryer, Sansa just stood there, unable to move.

She was not sure why she was speechless and why she stood frozen to the floor. She knew Jon ever since she had been a little girl. And just like every little girl she had had a small crush on her big brother’s best friend. But she had thought that that crush had subsided, that her heart had calmed down, that Jon was nothing but an amazing friend. It seemed she had been hopelessly wrong.

“Sansa?” Jon walked a little closer towards her and he pressed the palms of his hands to her cheeks. “Are you alright?” He cocked his head and Sansa swallowed. He was not making things better now. Actually, he was mostly making things worse.

Her heart was now racing in her chest and she felt the adrenaline rushing through her veins. Every cell in her body and every sensitive part of her skin was reacting. “Yes, yes…” She tripped over her words once more and she wished for a hole in the ground that would swallow her. “It’s just…” She let her eyes wander of his body once more and she stuck the tip of her tongue between her slightly parted lips. “You’ve surprised me a little.”

“I surprised you?” Jon raised his eyebrows, but a smirk appeared on his face. “In a good or in a bad way?” He kept his hands firmly on her cheeks and he leaned in slightly so Sansa could feel his warm breath on her nose.

She swallowed. “That depends on what will happen next.” Her voice was nothing but a soft whisper and a little reluctantly she placed her hands on his shoulders. Touching his muscles was even better than looking at them.

“What do you want to happen?” Jon spoke softly and his lips were now almost touching hers.

She smiled. “I want you to kiss me.” When her glance met his she saw a spark there, a small spark that had never been there before. “And more.” She let his shoulder go and placed her flat hand on his bare chest. “Because I don’t think I can get over you a second time.”

“A second time?” Jon’s nose brushed hers and her cheeks started glowing.

“Don’t tell me you didn’t know.” Sansa’s arms circled around his neck and somehow she was afraid that at some point Jon would step back.

But he didn’t.

“It’s impossible that you’ve never noticed my crush on you and all the pathetic excuses I came up with to talk to you and get your attention.”

“I always thought…” Jon took a deep breath. “It was simply because you hadn’t really met any other guys yet.”

“I have now.” Sansa closed the remaining distance between them and pressed her soft lips on his. She couldn’t believe she was really doing this. She couldn’t believe she was kissing Jon Snow. And she most of all couldn’t believe he was not pulling back. “And they can’t compete with you.” She kissed him more firmly now and she buried her hands in his still wet curls.

When Jon kissed her back the wet clothes in need of a dryer were forgotten. Just like time and the raging storm.
trail.content_abstract:
Written for day 3 of @jonsaspringblossoms based on the prompt RAIN or SUNSHINE or STORM

The storm and rain are the perfect companions for a lazy day with a good book. But just when Sansa is about to start reading the doorbell rings and a soaked Jon shows up at her doorstep.

Modern AU // College AU

Sansa made herself comfortable in the lazy chair in the living room. The heater filled the cold room with warmth, but she draped an extra fleece blanket over her legs. On the table next to her stood a big mug filled with damping hot tea. The mug stood next to the newest novel she had bought a few days ago, even though she had promised her mother to read all the books she already owned first.

The rain ticking against the window was nothing but background music. The howling wind circling around the house to attempt to rip the tiles off the roof simply added to the spooky atmosphere. It was the perfect day to just stay in and read, to get lost in a story and to only find her way back to the real world after she had read it all.

But she had barely read three pages when the doorbell echoed through the empty house. For a brief second she contemplated simply not opening, but then the doorbell rang again.

Longer this time. And much louder too.

With a soft moan Sansa stood up from her chair and she shivered when her bare feet touched the ice cold floor. On the tips of her toes she rushed towards the front door and she opened it only slightly, determined to simply send the intruder away as soon as she could.

“Sansa!” Jon’s dark black curls were glued to his forehead and the contours of his muscles were clearly visible through his soaked white shirt. He had his arms wrapped around him, but his teeth were clattering and his entire body shook visibly. “Thank goodness you’re home.” He let out a relieved sigh. “I wasn’t really looking forward to walking another three miles like this.”

Sansa thought about her book, waiting for her to be read, but then she opened the front door a little wider so Jon could step inside. “What were you even doing out there? They’ve warned countless of times that a huge storm was coming and that we shouldn’t leave our homes, unless in the case of an emergency.”
